title: Suggest removal of type ascription in stable

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

labels.name: D-verbose
labels.description: Too much output caused by a single piece of incorrect code

body:
Given the following code:

```rust
use std::fs::read_to_string;
fn main() {
   let input: String = read_to_string ("file.txt").unwrap() ;
    let good_lines: Vec<_> = input: String  
        .lines(): Lines
        .filter(|l |capital_letter (l)): impl Iterator<Itm = &str>
        .collect();
```

[The current output is](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=7ef86289ce3518aa4c3b028988042c2f):

```
error: casts cannot be followed by a method call
 [--> src/main.rs:4:30
](https://play.rust-lang.org/#)  |
4 |     let good_lines: Vec<_> = input: String  
  |                              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
help: try surrounding the expression in parentheses
  |
4 |     let good_lines: Vec<_> = (input: String)  
  |                              +             +

error: casts cannot be followed by a method call
 [--> src/main.rs:4:30
](https://play.rust-lang.org/#)  |
4 |       let good_lines: Vec<_> = input: String  
  |  ______________________________^
5 | |         .lines(): Lines
  | |_______________________^
  |
help: try surrounding the expression in parentheses
  |
4 ~     let good_lines: Vec<_> = (input: String  
5 ~         .lines(): Lines)
  |

error: casts cannot be followed by a method call
 [--> src/main.rs:4:30
](https://play.rust-lang.org/#)  |
4 |       let good_lines: Vec<_> = input: String  
  |  ______________________________^
5 | |         .lines(): Lines
6 | |         .filter(|l|capital_letter (l)): impl Iterator<Itm = &str>
  | |_________________________________________________________________^
  |
help: try surrounding the expression in parentheses
  |
4 ~     let good_lines: Vec<_> = (input: String  
5 |         .lines(): Lines
6 ~         .filter(|l|capital_letter (l)): impl Iterator<Itm = &str>)
  |
```

It should (instead?/also?) suggest *removing* the type ascription, as it is more likely what the end user wanted. Particularly in stable compilers.

_Taken from https://users.rust-lang.org/t/cannot-compile-my-code/72894_
